comment: Floral nose  you can tell this kid is young  decent finish but needs more wood
Very immature bourbon.  Heavy corn flavor with limited flavor profile.  Needs to age another five years.
Hot and young. I'd been wanting to try King's County for ages, and was rather disappointed.
Did not try. Will not let me clear rating.
Saw the master distiller in Louisville, KY at the .bourbon Classic. Never drank the whiskey.

I've had the chocolate iteration of this brand.  I won some at a company party.  It has to be one of the most aweful flavored whiskies I've ever had.  It smells of super dark cacao, and licorice.  It hits hard and leaves a synthetic syrup residue in your mouth.  I'll be passing this off to somebody else who is curious about this little quirk.
Very young, very floral. Not bad, got as a gift and will probably end up in cocktails.
Not a fan at all.  Maybe if it aged a bit longer.
This was fun Bourbon to try. Hada very buttery finish. I didn't like it enough to search out but trying it.

Strong nose
Oak med strong, not too spicy
Sweet

Easy, soft mouthfeel, light sweetness, very balanced. Vanilla and spice through the mid palate and finish. Impressive for how little aging it gets. Testament to quality of ingredients and skill in whiskey making
It might be my novice palate for bourbon, but I really liked this. It was an easy drinker, and it had enough "character" to keep my interest.
9.15.17-Three stars for the chocolate bourbon.  Not sweet, deeper darker chocolate flavor.

2/5 Very grainy and under mature. Lots of issues here: 1) they should not be making such a heavy distillate with pot stills if they aren’t going to age longer, 2) open fermenters in NYC climate creates consistency issues, 3) minimal aging using small casks creates a harsh, immature spirit, and 4) I’d include wheat or rye in the mashbill. Just corn and malted barley makes for a pretty one dimensional bourbon IMO. Really not a fan of this, particularly at the price point.

It's like that time when you see a college student hitting on an older woman at a wedding reception. He is well intentioned and has all the makings of a good choice but is just missing about 4-6 years.

Not unpleasant, but ultimately a difficult bourbon to cheer for. There's a certain immaturity to the whisky that I found myself unable to get past, although the honeyed notes are welcome. The finish is smooth and clean, yet predictably short.

Straight Bourbon Batch 141: LOTS of American oak on the nose (I like American oak so I consider this a good thing), with some vanilla in there as well. Palate is nondescript grain, but with a pretty strong and tasty smoke/char note at the end. I don’t get the “youth” that others on here seem to, but I definitely agree with the one dimensional-ness. Overall, the flavor doesn’t quite deliver on what the nose seems to promise, but wow am I excited about what will come from this place.
Tasting @ the distillery. Nice smooth and easy to drink. Vanilla, brown sugar and pepper. One of the better micro Bourbons out there, however, the cask strength is Sooo much better.

Best I've had from New York thus far. While it is noticeably young, it is very balanced. Rich and sweet on the palate. This a good effort from a young distillery, I look forward to seeing what a few years does for their product.
A very nice balanced sipper but absurdly overpriced
Sweet corn, vanilla, cinnamon, and anise. Nose is muted, palate doesn't develop much and finish is short leaving something to be desired but altogether a tasty and inoffensive whiskey.
Purchased in NYC and knew nothing of bourbon so I took a flyer on this and was more than slightly disappointed. The short ageing doesn't do it any favors.

Oak & honey nose and taste. High corn mash comes through. Smooth but simple
Too young - 2 years aged. Flavors are all subdued
Carmel corn aroma. Raisin, baking spices, almost citrus-like finish.
Very sugary on the nose. Bits of brown sugar and caramel used fruits. Caramel apple?! Well rounded with barrel spice. Vanillas and warm butterscotch notes.
Very warm, spicy, long finish, vanilla
Very smoked vanilla followed by cream tase. Smells strongly of vanilla
Corn forward. Has a musty taste that reminds me of an old mill but it’s actually  quite pleasing and nostalgic. Smooth finish. I want another glass.
Oaky flavor with spice and burnt caramel
Lovely alcohol tinge. Salty caramel taste.

스트레이트버번
80%뉴욕옥수수+20%영국맥아
큰매력없는 옥수수향, 약간의계피, 바닐라, 버번 기본의 오크향이 거의 없음
